events.name: Lithium-ion value chain and raw material extraction
events.wd_label: Lithium-ion value chain and raw material extraction
events.wd_description: The lithium-ion value chain begins with the extraction of raw materials such as lithium, cobalt, and nickel. These materials are refined and processed, with significant production and refining capacity concentrated in a few countries.
events.description: The lithium-ion value chain begins with the extraction of raw materials such as lithium, cobalt, and nickel. These materials are refined and processed, with significant production and refining capacity concentrated in a few countries.

events.name: Raw material extraction
events.wd_description: More than 90 percent of the world's lithium is produced in Australia, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, and China. The Democratic Republic of Congo accounts for over three-quarters of global cobalt output.
events.description: More than 90 percent of the world's lithium is produced in Australia, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, and China. The Democratic Republic of Congo accounts for over three-quarters of global cobalt output.

events.name: Lithium production
events.wd_description: Lithium is produced in Australia, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, and China.
events.description: Lithium is produced in Australia, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, and China.

events.name: Cobalt production
events.wd_description: The Democratic Republic of Congo accounts for over three-quarters of global cobalt output.
events.description: The Democratic Republic of Congo accounts for over three-quarters of global cobalt output.

events.name: Nickel production
events.wd_description: Nickel production is geographically dispersed, with Russia being the largest producer.
events.description: Nickel production is geographically dispersed, with Russia being the largest producer.

events.name: Refining capacity
events.wd_description: China is the largest refiner of lithium and cobalt, holding a significant share of the refining capacity. Nickel refining is more geographically dispersed.
events.description: China is the largest refiner of lithium and cobalt, holding a significant share of the refining capacity. Nickel refining is more geographically dispersed.

events.name: Lithium refining
events.wd_description: China accounts for 61 percent of global lithium refining capacity, followed by Chile and Argentina.
events.description: China accounts for 61 percent of global lithium refining capacity, followed by Chile and Argentina.

events.name: Cobalt refining
events.wd_description: China holds 72 percent of global cobalt refining capacity, with the balance in Europe.
events.description: China holds 72 percent of global cobalt refining capacity, with the balance in Europe.

events.name: Nickel refining
events.wd_description: Nickel refining is geographically dispersed, with China holding 16 percent of the market share.
events.description: Nickel refining is geographically dispersed, with China holding 16 percent of the market share.

events.name: Geographical concentration
events.wd_description: The production and refining of critical materials like lithium and cobalt are concentrated in specific countries, leading to supply chain dependencies.
events.description: The production and refining of critical materials like lithium and cobalt are concentrated in specific countries, leading to supply chain dependencies.

events.name: Battery component production and market share
events.wd_label: Battery component production and market share
events.wd_description: The refined materials are processed into battery components such as cathodes, anodes, separators, and electrolytes. China, Japan, and Korea dominate the market share for these components, with China holding the largest share.
events.description: The refined materials are processed into battery components such as cathodes, anodes, separators, and electrolytes. China, Japan, and Korea dominate the market share for these components, with China holding the largest share.

events.name: Cathode production
events.wd_description: China holds 52 percent of the market share for cathode production, the most important component of a battery cell.
events.description: China holds 52 percent of the market share for cathode production, the most important component of a battery cell.

events.name: Anode production
events.wd_description: China holds 78 percent of the market share for anode production.
events.description: China holds 78 percent of the market share for anode production.

events.name: Separator production
events.wd_description: China holds 66 percent of the market share for separator production.
events.description: China holds 66 percent of the market share for separator production.

events.name: Electrolyte production
events.wd_description: China holds 62 percent of the market share for electrolyte production, while the United States has 8 percent.
events.description: China holds 62 percent of the market share for electrolyte production, while the United States has 8 percent.

events.name: Cell manufacturing and future capacity
events.wd_description: Battery components are assembled into cells, with 78 percent of global cell manufacturing capacity located in China. There are planned capacity additions in China and Europe, while the US lags behind.
events.description: Battery components are assembled into cells, with 78 percent of global cell manufacturing capacity located in China. There are planned capacity additions in China and Europe, while the US lags behind.

events.name: Current cell manufacturing capacity
events.wd_description: 78 percent of the world's cell manufacturing capacity is located in China, with some capacity in Europe and the United States.
events.description: 78 percent of the world's cell manufacturing capacity is located in China, with some capacity in Europe and the United States.

events.name: Future capacity additions
events.wd_description: There are more planned capacity additions in China and Europe compared to the United States.
events.description: There are more planned capacity additions in China and Europe compared to the United States.

events.name: US capacity
events.wd_description: Even with all planned projects, the US will have about one-tenth of China's cell manufacturing capacity by 2025.
events.description: Even with all planned projects, the US will have about one-tenth of China's cell manufacturing capacity by 2025.

events.name: Solar PV manufacturing value chain
events.wd_description: The solar PV manufacturing value chain consists of five main components: polysilicon, ingots, wafers, cells, and modules. The upstream parts are technically challenging and capital-intensive, with significant consolidation in the market.
events.description: The solar PV manufacturing value chain consists of five main components: polysilicon, ingots, wafers, cells, and modules. The upstream parts are technically challenging and capital-intensive, with significant consolidation in the market.

events.name: Polysilicon production
events.wd_description: The upstream part of the PV value chain, polysilicon production, is highly consolidated with significant Chinese presence.
events.description: The upstream part of the PV value chain, polysilicon production, is highly consolidated with significant Chinese presence.

events.name: Ingot production
events.wd_description: Ingot production is integrated within wafer plants and is capital-intensive.
events.description: Ingot production is integrated within wafer plants and is capital-intensive.

events.name: Wafer production
events.wd_description: Over 90 percent of the world's wafer production capacity is in China, crucial for PV supply chain dominance.
events.description: Over 90 percent of the world's wafer production capacity is in China, crucial for PV supply chain dominance.

events.name: Cell production
events.wd_description: The production of solar PV cells involves converting wafers into functional cells.
events.description: The production of solar PV cells involves converting wafers into functional cells.

events.name: Module production
events.wd_description: The final part of the PV value chain, module production, is also dominated by Chinese firms with 72 percent of global capacity.
events.description: The final part of the PV value chain, module production, is also dominated by Chinese firms with 72 percent of global capacity.

events.name: Geographical concentration of production
events.description: More than 90% of the world's lithium is produced in five countries, with China being the largest refiner.

events.name: Geographical concentration of refining
events.description: China holds a significant share in the refining capacity of lithium, cobalt, and nickel, contributing to supply chain concentration.

events.name: Market share of battery components
events.description: China, Japan, and Korea hold major shares in the production of cathodes, anodes, separators, and electrolytes, with China being the largest.

events.name: Limited US presence in component production
events.description: The US has a meaningful presence only in electrolyte production, with limited involvement in other components.

events.name: Planned capacity additions in cell manufacturing
events.description: There is significant planned capacity addition in China and Europe, with the US trailing significantly.

events.name: Polysilicon market concentration
events.description: The polysilicon market is highly consolidated, with a significant presence of Chinese firms.

events.name: Wafer manufacturing dominance
events.description: More than 90% of wafer manufacturing capacity is located in China, highlighting the country's dominance.

events.name: Module manufacturing vertical integration
events.description: Vertical integration benefits existing producers in module manufacturing, with Chinese companies holding a large share.
